image.altText: The front of a budget book with a navy cover and Australian government logo printed on it that says "Budget 2025-26".

props.synopsis: It was the federal budget that almost didn't happen, but the government is set to deliver its fourth budget tonight before voters head to the polls by mid-May. Here's every announcement that we already know about.

title.children: Today's budget will set the tone of the election. Here's everything we know

image.altText: Side profile of Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: This year's budget is being delivered at one of the most pivotal points in recent history, yet the federal government has been tempering expectations that there won't be much worth writing home about.

title.children: A federal budget that's tiptoeing around the edge of reality

image.altText: Budget Chalmers

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers will hand down his fourth budget today as Australians inch closer to heading to the federal election. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers prepares to deliver pre-election budget

image.altText: An anonymous woman silouhette, with her looking onto a busy street in Kings Cross, with people walking by, blurred.

props.synopsis: An American man filmed women in Sydney's east with recording glasses and posted the footage to social media without the women's consent.

title.children: US content creator secretly filmed Sydney women with sunglasses camera

image.altText: Pete Hegseth speaks into a microphone with his hand held out.

props.synopsis: A US magazine editor appears to have been sent classified military plans after Donald Trump's national security team accidentally included him in their group chat.

title.children: Magazine editor 'accidentally' included in Trump team's war group chat

image.altText: David Gonski with grey hair and black-rimmed glasses, and smiling slightly, turns his head to face a person just visible nearby

props.synopsis: In 2011 David Gonski proposed school funding reforms with one goal in mind: giving all children an equal shot at an education. Now, after 14 years of false starts, his model will finally be implemented.

title.children: After 14 years of false starts, Gonski's reforms are finally becoming reality

image.altText: Assualt in The Gap

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been charged with murder after a 79-year-old woman was found stabbed at a home in northern Brisbane on Monday.

title.children: Victorian man charged with murdering 79-year-old woman in Brisbane

image.altText: A giant flame roars from gas flare stack, silhouetted against the dusk sky

props.synopsis: Gas giants would be forced to supply more energy to the domestic energy market in exchange for more lax environmental regulations under gas reservation plans that could be adopted by both sides of politics.

title.children: Gas giants could be forced to divert supply to Australia

image.altText: the gabba stadium

props.synopsis: Premier David Crisafulli will unveil his government's final delivery plan for the Brisbane Games — including the site for the athlete's village, the future of the Gabba and whether a new stadium will be built at Victoria Park.

title.children: The future of Queensland's Olympic venues will be revealed today

image.altText: A group of protesters holding Turkish flags on the street. They are wet after being doused by a water cannon.

props.synopsis: The arrest of one of President Tayyip Erdogan's high-profile political rivals has sparked the biggest street protests in the country in more than a decade.

title.children: More than 1,100 protesters arrested as Türkiye demonstrations escalate

image.altText: A block of Soviet-style apartment blocks damaged and smoldering after being damaged by a missile.

props.synopsis: The attack on the Ukrainian city of Sumy came as US and Russian negotiators were meeting in Saudi Arabia to discuss a proposed partial ceasefire.

title.children: Russian missile strike on Ukrainian city of Sumy injures 74, including children

image.altText: Gerard Depardieu arrives in court dressed in black

props.synopsis: Prosecutors allege the assaults against two women - whose full identities have not been revealed - took place during the filming in 2021 of "Les Volets Verts" (The Green Shutters).

title.children: French actor Gerard Depardieu goes on trial for sexual assault

image.altText: Sadia Sulaiman carries a blue polio vaccine esky.

props.synopsis: Pakistan is one of only two countries where polio remains endemic and it is aiming to eradicate it by 2027, but with cases soaring last year, experts and officials worry it will miss its goal.

title.children: How the CIA inadvertently caused fear of the polio vaccine in Pakistan

image.altText: A woman is unidentifiable wearing a hat and white long sleeved shirt, looking out to sea.

props.synopsis: Bec says the initial assault paled in comparison to navigating the court system in regional Australia and dealing with her aggressor in a tiny town.

title.children: 'There's no anonymity': What it's like surviving assault in a small town

image.altText: A man holds his hand under his nose while holding gumleaves and reading from paper, surrounded by others in the same shirts.

props.synopsis: The coroner was due to start hearing evidence into the death in custody but lawyers for operators at Loddon Prison have argued against the admissibility of allegations against healthcare staff.

title.children: Inquest delayed as lawyers for prison operators fight expert report

image.altText: Cars stopped close to one another in peak hour traffic

props.synopsis: Noise pollution can impact our physical and mental wellbeing, so periods of silence throughout the day may just be the antidote.

title.children: Is our noisy world making us sick?

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Daly Cherry-Evans points with his left hand

props.synopsis: Manly will be without its captain from next season onwards as Daly Cherry-Evans goes public with his desire to leave the only NRL club he has ever known.

title.children: Cherry-Evans confirms desire to leave Manly after rejecting latest offer

image.altText: Harley Reid holds a football in each hand

props.synopsis: West Coast has been issued a 'please explain' by the AFL over an offensive gesture made by second-year star Harley Reid in his side's loss to Brisbane.

title.children: Reid issued 'please explain' by AFL after giving fans the middle finger

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor will push through legislation today that could derail a legal battle over salmon farming's impact on an endangered ray and safeguard the industry's future in Tasmania.

title.children: Environmental laws set to be scaled back in parliament's final days to save salmon jobs

image.altText: Disability Rights Advocacy Service wide shot

props.synopsis: One of the state's largest disability advocacy services has gone into administration and an "urgent assessment of its operations and financial position" is underway.

title.children: Disability advocacy service in administration as 'urgent' assessment underway

image.altText: A hung up portrait of a man in formal attire with a gold frame.

props.synopsis: The US president took to Truth Social to call for the removal of his "purposefully distorted" portrait on display in Denver, by an artist who "must have lost her talent as she got older".

title.children: 'Obama looks wonderful, but mine is the worst': Trump demands removal of portrait

image.altText: 23andme headquarters in Silicon Valley

props.synopsis: The company, which provides its customers with saliva-based test kits to help them learn their ancestry, is seeking to sell its assets, which include users' DNA data.

title.children: DNA testing firm 23andMe files for bankruptcy after CEO's failed takeover bids

image.altText: a woman claps while a man in a blue tie waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: Usha Vance, the wife of US Vice President JD Vance, is set to make a high profile visit to Greenland this week.

title.children: Greenland’s PM slams visit by US officials, including Usha Vance

image.altText: A bald man getting out of a black car wearing a hoody

props.synopsis: Influencers Andrew and Tristan Tate have reported to a police station in Romania after weeks spent in the US.

title.children: Andrew and Tristan Tate report to police station in Romania

image.altText: Three Palestinian childrensit together

props.synopsis: The number of Gazans killed in the current conflict surpasses the death toll for any Arab conflict with Israel in more than 40 years.

title.children: As the death toll passes 50,000, 'everyone is targeted' in Gaza

image.altText: Calculator sits on pile of bills

props.synopsis: The federal government is promising another power bill rebate. But questions remain about the long-term solutions to Australia's energy price pains.

title.children: Causes of higher power prices remain as government offers $150 rebate

image.altText: A tractor is pictured on a dry hill in regional Victoria with some hay being unrolled

props.synopsis: Paddocks in Victoria's north and east have been replenished by a big dump of rain, but some farmers fear the regions that need it most are going without.

title.children: Drought conditions worsen in parts of Victoria despite downpour

image.altText: On a stage with audience seated behind, a man in police uniform sits back in his chair laughing vigorously.

props.synopsis: Classic Australian play The Removalists has been restaged half a century after it was written, and it reveals a shocking relevance to today.

title.children: Shockingly relevant play is restaged 50 years after it was written

image.altText: A man in a blue polo shirt speaks in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: The WA Liberals look set to become the state's official opposition party once again, after claiming victory in a seventh seat, by less than 100 votes.

title.children: WA Liberals claim Kalamunda victory, paving way for return to opposition

image.altText: Alex Hodgman warming up for the Wallabies in 2024.

props.synopsis: A former All Blacks prop is in the frame to be wearing Wallabies colours against the British and Irish Lions, while Harry Wilson shows his leadership value in the latest round of Super Rugby Pacific.

title.children: Ex-All Black presses claim to face Lions as Wallabies skipper stands tall

image.altText: A middle-aged caucasian women with shoulder length blonde hair

props.synopsis: The mother of British transgender teen Brianna Ghey speaks out in support of a social media ban for children aged under 16.

title.children: 'Absolute cesspit': Mother of murdered teen Brianna Ghey backs under-16 social media ban

image.altText: People hold placards and protest at the USAID building in Washington

props.synopsis: Sweden, Norway and the Netherlands have contact US officials asking for their unspent contributions to USAID — a program Donald Trump has halted — to be refunded.

title.children: Sweden, Norway and the Netherlands want their money back from USAID

image.altText: A woman in red blazer is grinning

props.synopsis: Love was elected to the US House of Representatives in 2014, becoming the first African-American Republican woman in Congress and the first Black lawmaker to represent Utah.

title.children: Mia Love, first Black Republican woman elected to US Congress, dies aged 49

image.altText: A young woman sitting on a horse holding a ball with straps on it, used in the sport of horseball

props.synopsis: You've probably never heard of horseball, but young Australians are making a name for themselves in the sport's world cup, which starts today.

title.children: Young riders represent Australia in adrenaline-fuelled equestrian sport
